Sheila's place was great. I stayed from Dec. 16-20, 2016 with my husband and 15 year old son to see the sites and attend a Giants game and an Islanders game. The location is trendy and fun with many amenities close by. There are multiple subway stations close by making it simple to get around the city (we took the subway everywhere including back to the airport when heading home). We were able to enjoy the sites of NYC, but able to escape the craziness by returning to Sheila's place at the end of a very busy day. Shelia was so friendly and accommodating. She gave us tips on places to eat and things to do. We would return and stay at Sheila's place again.
We stayed there 10 days and is was awesome. Both were so nice. Very thing was perfect. If we have another stay in NYC we will book this again!!
Excellent location, close to a lot of shops and restaurants. A lot of New York character in this neighborhood. Sheila and Manny were excellent hosts throughout the entire stay.

This is a beautiful oasis in a very quiet building.  A short walk to great restaurants, the subway, and late night groceries, you couldn't find a better home away from home in NYC.  Thank you Sheila and Manny for the awesome stay!

The place is awesome in every way! Apartment is very nice, neighbourhood is a genuin New York neighbourhood and you can really get the feeling like you're a real new yorker! Hosts are also very thoughtful and help in every way needed!
Sheila and Manny were great hosts and we enjoyed our stay in the East Village very much. I would recommend them and their place to anyone!

Loved the location in East Village not far from subway stations. Sheila was available to help with any questions, and full of great local knowledge.  Apartment newly renovated and very cosy. We were there in winter, but it has a lovely outdoor garden for warmer times of year

L'appartement de Sheila est bien situé
Calme et propre, très fonctionnel. Sheila est très accueillante et disponible, pleine de délicates attentions.
St Marks Place est un des coins les plus agréables de NY
Nous y avons passé un séjour très agréable, les enfants ont adoré.
Encore merci à Sheila

Great studio in a fantastic location. We felt right at home and in the heart of the East Village. It was surprising to us how quiet the apartment was given how bustling the street outside was and its proximity to bars and restaurants - remarkable. All the furniture was clean and comfortable and the hosts Sheila and Manny that perfect mixture of helpfulness without interfering. The location makes it easy to explore this vibrant area locally (don't miss out on the Tenement Museum experience), Chinatown for Dim Sum and is near to the subway to go further afield. We'd definitely stay there again and in fact have already recommended it to a family member. Thanks for the stay!

Sheila and Manny are wonderful hosts -- gracious, friendly and helpful. They thoughtfully welcomed us with apple juice (for our six-year old), wine and snacks. The apartment was very comfortable and well-appointed. We spent one low-key evening on the couch and remarked what a nice space it was to hang out and relax in. Thank you Manny and Sheila!

Perfect AirBnb experience. A lively neighborhood, a great and comfortable and large living space and wonderful, warm and helpful hosts. Sheila and Manny made us feel part of the family. Special note:  The best equipped apartment...down to umbrellas and raincoats, toothpaste and milk, coffee and fresh fruit and nuts and more.  Felt very taken care of.

A superb place to stay in the boisterous East Village, with easy access to the R/6/etc. 24 hour eateries and markets are close by. The studio is very clean, with excellent furnishings, equipment, fixtures, plumbing, electricity, doors, locks, internet, satellite TV, and cellular reception. It is a basement studio, but it is dry with no mustiness. The studio has its own entry from the street. The studio is placed to the back of the building, so it's surprisingly quiet for sleeping. Sheila and Manny are fabulous people and helpful. This would be my first choice for visits to NYC.

Nous sommes allés à New-York pour une durée de 5 jours sur place et à 4 adultes.
A notre arrivée , pourtant tardive , Manny nous attendait et nous a expliqué tout ce que nous devions savoir. Le logement est très confortable dans une rue animée (bars et restaurants)ce qui plaira aux noctambules et pour les autres pas de panique il est en retrait de la rue donc pas de nuisances sonores et cela même pendant la Saint Patrick...Sheila a même eu la gentillesse de nous inviter ce soir là mais nous étions malheureusement trop fatigués pour en profiter.
Une station de métro se trouve à 5 minutes à pied et beaucoup de taxis sont dans la rue ce qui est très pratique nottament pour se rendre a l'aéroport.
Manny et Sheila ont toujours étaient disponibles pour répondre à nos questions ce qui était vraiment agréable.
Nous vous recommandons vivement ce logement pour le lieu ainsi que pour les hôtes qui sont vraiment adorables.
Nous y retournerions sans problème.....
Sheila's place is clean, comfortable and convenient. Everything one might want or need is provided. Sheila is available to help with anything and is an excellent host.

Sheila was a great host. She was very welcoming and was available if we had any questions. The apt was clean spacious and even had a washer and dryer. Sheila was kind enough to supply coffee, laundry detergent, snacks and wine.The location is close to everything including well known restaurants and cafes, subway lines. She went above and beyond my expectations. I would definitely recommend to stay here. By far this has been the best airbnb experience I have had.

L'appartement est calme car en arrière cour et pourtant est dans une rue vivante , pleins de petits restaurants et de petites supérettes à côté . Le métro est à 5 minutes et Times square est à 40 min à pieds . 
Vous avez tous à disposition, savon, serviettes , sèche cheveux, machine à laver et sèche linge bref le top !!!

L'hôte est à votre disposition si vous avez besoin, je ne rajouterai qu'une  chose -> n'hésitez pas !!!

Wir können die Wohnung von Sheila sehr empfehlen!!
Sie ist mit allem ausgestattet, was man braucht, sogar mit Grundnahrungsmittel. Damit haben wir nicht gerechnet und waren daher positiv überrascht. Am ersten Abend hat uns Sheila sogar eine Schüssel frisch gemachte Pasta vorbeigebracht, da wir schon so müde waren.
Die Lage der Wohnung haben wir als optimal empfunden: nahe zur Subway, in einem lebhaften Stadtteil mit zahlreichen Lokalen und Restaurants. Aber durch die Lage im Innenhof eine absolut ruhige Oase - traumhaft!  Wir haben uns sehr zu Hause gefühlt, auch durch die liebe Betreuung von Sheila und ihre vielen hilfreichen Tipps. Wir würden gerne wieder kommen! Danke Sheila!

Sheila and Manny are truly outstanding hosts which is why I came back to stay with them again after a previous visit. The apartment is very cosy and comfortable, ideally located and has all the amenities that one might need. Highly recommended!

We had the most wonderful stay at Sheila's and Manny's. 5 Star all around. The apartment was spotless, cozy, excellently laid out, had cheery decor and was superbly equipped in every respect -- including umbrellas and ponchos. It was a great location.  The street was busy in an intriguing NY way but our haven was quiet as could be. Sheila and Manny made us feel welcome with their warmth and fresh flowers and a welcoming bottle of wine, coffee, etc. Sheila and Manny have set a new gold standard for air bnb. Val and Karl

Das Appartment liegt super. Perfekt, um Manhattan zu erkunden. Die Straße ist lebendig mit vielen tollen Bars und Restaurants, im Appartment hört man davon nichts, echt klasse. Die Kommunikation lief reibungslos und im Appartment war alles wie angegeben und es war absolut sauber. Insgesamt echt toll!

I am an Airbnb super host in Phoenix, Arizona that is very picky about where I stay due to a terrible experience in Las Vegas in April. Seeing that Sheila was a super host as well is what sealed the deal. I knew that she must have met the high standards Airbnb sets to obtain and maintain super host status. Let me say that she did not dissapoint!!!! 

My best friend and I had never been to NYC before and really had no idea what to expect. Sheila was very communicative and even checked in via text a few times to make sure we had everything we needed. We had lots of questions and she was more than happy to help in any way. The apartment was spacious and well appointed. There was fresh fruit, nuts, pretzels, milk, butter and other condiments in the fridge which was nice since we arrived in the later evening. There were groceries right around the corner at a small market which was a 3 minute walk. The entire street was lively and incredibly beautiful, filled with shops and bars and restaurants. Plan to spend some time there as it's equally cool as the rest of Manhattan.

The back outdoor area was a definite treat and a charming place to relax. We sat on the front steps on Friday night and watched all the people come home from work. I could really feel the sense of community once Sheila and Manny joined us and the neighbors came around with hugs and we all shared some laughs. I felt so comfortable and safe there at all times. We slept very well every night, even when the street was pumpin, because the apartment is the basement level and towards the back so it's surprisingly quiet. There is private access to the gardens in back and above ground windows so it doesn't feel basement-like at all.

This is the place to stay if you want an authentic New York experience with natives that really care. Thank you again Sheila and Manny!!!! :D 

Jackie, Phoenix Arizona & Jennifer, Salem Oregon

Sheila and Manny were the perfect hosts! The apartment was extremely clean, well cared for and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this to anyone going to NY, the location is perfect and you have your own "outside space" for relaxing at the end of the day or drinking your morning coffee.
Not only was this a perfect place for me and my girlfriends to stay for a NYC vacation, the hosts were fabulously helpful for all our needs. We will be back!!

The apartment is very nice, well-equipped and new. It is in a interesting, tipical and very lively area of NY, but the house results quiet and it's located in the same building of the owner. Manny (Emanuele) and Sheila are nice people, always available and friendly!

Sono buone persone che aiutano in ogni circostanza, molto disponibili. Manny ha origini italiane e parla perfettamente italiano! Consigliatissimo!

We can't recommend staying at Sheila's place highly enough. Such a generous and welcoming family, you immediately feel at home. If you're looking for a taste of East Village life you're in the perfect spot with the ideal host. The room is spotless, has everything you need, and is surprisingly quiet for a lively street like St Marks. Sheila and Manny are big-hearted, knowledgeable and great fun to spend time with - you couldn't ask for more!

The appartement is really great. Close to metro and lot of restaurants. Well placed in Manhattan. It's quiet and has everything needed. Even more like the small garden. Sheila and Manny were really great and friendly. Always available for a small talk. They give us lot of nice adresses in East Village and they even offered us a great breakfast and a nice napkin. We really enjoyed our week in their place.
Amazing !!! The hosts made us feel like we've been old time friends. We will DEFINITELY come back in the future!

Thank you Sheila and Manny. Your little oasis is the city was perfect for my family. We were able to fit comfortably in the apartment. The ability to do laundry was so great - the fact that you provided detergent, and I did not have to go purchase that after a long day walking around as a tourist was amazing! These extra touches are what make staying with you such a treat. I was traveling alone with 3 children and I felt safe in this location. We traveled primarily by subway and the 3 block walk was easy each morning and night. As you said "we did it all from baseball to Broadway " having a great place to stay made it all so enjoyable. Thanks y'all !

Idéalement situé. Ambiance du quartier très agréable et architecture typique. Très bons conseils pratiques des hôtes. Hôtes très conviviaux. Petits commerces ouverts 24h/24h + épicerie bio à proximité. Broadway à 10- 15 min.

What a wonderful place this is. If you want comfort and ease and access in the east village, this is the place. Lovely hosts. A great place to feel like a local. Although the hood is vibrant, the space is a refuge of quiet and rest. I'll be back.
Sheila was a wonderful host, very helpful and welcoming.  The apartment is beautiful,  clean and cute and the location couldn't be better.  It's a great value and we hope to return soon!

l'accoglienza, la gentilezza e la disponibilità 
la casa era perfettamente pulita e corrisponde totalmente a quanto descritto
la zona è animata e piena di locali
assolutamente consigliato

Obrigada Sheila, nossa estadia foi maravilhosa, tivemos uma experiência incrível em NY. 
O apartamento é lindo, estava limpo e muito bem localizado. 
Sheila e Benny foram um amor e nos ajudaram em tudo o que (Website hidden by Airbnb) certeza voltaremos em uma outra oportunidade.

Wow, what a great space and location. This is the place to be in NY if you love great food, hospitality in close proximity of the city's highlights, like Empire State building, Statten Island ferry and views to Statue of Liberty, Central Park, galleries and Broadway shows. Sheila & Manny were perfect hosts. Don't miss out on staying here.
A spacious and quiet oasis in a lively area with great hosts.

Sheila was an incredible host and I can't recommend her place enough. The price is fantastic for the area, the space is larger and cleaner than any hotel you're going to stay at and Sheila was always there ready at a moment's notice if I needed help with anything. I loved the spacious back patio and tips on nearby restaurants and markets left on the kitchen table were extremely helpful. I would absolutely stay again!

Sheila and Manny were the best hosts! The airbnb is clean, very cozy. My friend and I had an incredible time there. Sheila and Manny were very flexible regarding time for check-in and check-out which was very kind. The airbnb is very well located, vibrant and bustling area. Highly recommend to everyone and I am definitely coming back.

Fantastiskt läge och ren och fin lägenhet med en mysigt uteplats. Sheila och Manny var ett fantastiskt trevligt värdpar som gjorde vår resa till en fin upplevelse. Läget är perfekt och du är mitt i härliga East Village. Ett klockrent boende!!

Sheila's place is warm and inviting and exactly as promoted, your own private space with all of the amenities. Great neighborhood with easy access to the MTA and tasty restaurants and plenty of shopping opportunities. What's not to love! Did I mention she is a charming host!

Sheila and Manny were delightful! The apartment was roomy, clean, and had everything we could want. Beds were comfortable, with plenty of blankets and linens. It was quite and we slept fine without issue. It should accommodate most have but I’m sure they would do their best for whatever you need. They even let one of our guest keep her luggage at their place after checkout so she could enjoy the city before her late flight. 

Location of Shelia and Mannys place was ideal. We bought subway passes and didn’t use them because everything we did was walkable. We were having a girls weekend full of eating, shopping, and adult beverages! If you’re planning on shows and sight seeing you’ll use the subway more than we did. The neighborhood is lively and full of good food. Check out eater for recommendations, I’ve yet to be disappointed. Shelia and Manny also supply a list of suggestions. 

I would recommend this location to anyone! I’ve stayed a lot of places in NYC and this by far has been the best location for what I enjoy doing. Subway is about 2.5 to 3 blocks away which should take you anywhere you’d like to go in the city and beyond.
Nice and easy-going hosts. Apartment is nice and quiet and yet very conveniently located. Can definitely recommend.

Awesome East Village Apt! First off, you're in the middle of everything but at night, it's COMPLETELY QUIET. Being a bottom floor apt, the space doesn't get super bright light either, so if you want to sleep in, you won't have to deal with aggressive sunshine. Perfect for my tastes. The kitchen may the be best appointed AirBnb kitchen I've ever experienced. Fresh flowers, fruit, plenty of Kurig coffee pods, creamer in the fridge, even some beer and wine awaited us. Impressive closet/storage space, plenty of bathroom toiletries for your convenience, and I made use of the satellite music channels on the tv while hanging out. Once you leave, you're minutes from everything. Manny and Shelia were super helpful and communicative and friendly. I try to visit NYC once a year and would definitely stay here again for another Village Adventure.

The purpose of our trip was to our son and his family; Sheila's place is a few doors down the street from his place. For those new to New York, Sheila offers many references for sightseeing, provides umbrellas and ponchos for rainy weather and suggestions for grocery shopping in a real grocery store within walking distance. Sheila provides information on the subway system and she or Manny, her husband, are available to answer any questions a traveler may have either in person or by email or text. This apartment is clean, convenient and comfortable!

Sheila y Manny se ocuparon en cada momento de que nuestra estadía fuese impecable: recibieron paquetes de compras (muchos) sin ningún problema, nos invitaron a su cena de acción de gracias, muchos detalles en el apartamento (provisiones, limpieza y disponibilidad de elementos útiles).
Se trata de un apartamento con medidas ideales y muy bien equipado. La zona es inmejorable.
Solamente hubo un problema con la calefacción y el agua caliente por el que se preocuparon mucho y solucionaron en breve...
Definitivamente, si volvemos a NYC, Sheila y Manny serán nuestros anfitriones...

My husband, our two kids and I had a wonderful stay at Sheila's apartment. It was clean and spacious, with more amenities -- washer & dryer! backyard! big closet! -- than even a local might hope for. The location is just steps away from a number of great cafes and restaurants and only a couple blocks from the subway. The apartment is very well appointed; Sheila and Manny have really thought about every detail that might make a pleasant stay. We would be honored to stay here again!

The apartment is perfect and in a lovely area with restaurants and pubs on your doorstep. It’s also really close to public transport and only 4 stops on the subway to central Manhattan. 
Sheila & Manny really are super hosts and do everything they can to make you feel comfortable and make sure that you have everything you need throughout your stay! 
It’s a lovely apartment, very cosy and feels like coming home at the end of every day, would always recommend over a hotel and Sheila & Manny should be your first choice for the air b ‘n’ b experience.
Todo perfecto! Geniales anfitriones! El departamento es amplio y todo funciona perfectamente. Gran zona! Súper recomendable!
It was so nice being in a cozy home rather than a public hotel!  Sheila made sure we were comfortable, had everything we needed & all questions were answered.

Nous avons énormément apprécié l’accueil et la générosité de Sheila et son époux Manny.L’emplacement était idéal pour nous car nous avons arpenté Greenwich,Soho,le quartier chinois, Chelsea et même Times Square et Central Park en marchant. Pour le reste de nos visites on empruntait le métro. La situation de l’appartement est parfaite.L’immeuble donne sur une rue très animée mais l’appart est légèrement en retrait vers l’arrière de sorte que nous avions des nuits très paisibles.Notre logement comprenait tout ce dont nous avions besoin de sorte que nous nous sentions comme à la maison.Merci encore à nos chaleureux hôtes. À recommander sans hésitation.

Awesome New York City sanctuary.  The studio is clean, comfortable, perfectly outfitted, cozy and peaceful in the middle of the city's chaos.  Sheila and Manny are such nice, responsive and generous hosts.  I can't say enough good things about my visit and my hosts.

This place simply can't be beat. A very spacious studio with a garden. 
The apartment has EVERYTHING you need, and everything is where you need it! An amazing kitchen, great big closet, dresser for clothes, cable TV, wonderful oak table with 4 chairs. All very cozy. It feels like a home. Sheila is a wonderful host. Thanks for the bottle of wine and lovely poinsettia!
Great location, quiet apartment, good communication, will stay again!
Sheila was super responsive and helpful.  The apartment was super comfortable and I felt right at home.  It’s also close to lots of amazing restaurants.  Would definitely stay again!

The place was so convenient! Sheila was a great host. She found out we were there for my sister’s engagement, so she surprised us with a bottle of champagne to celebrate, which was so thoughtful. She was easily reachable throughout the entire trip through texting and was flexible when it came to check in/check out. Would definitely stay there again!

Sheila’s Place is fantastic! It’s in a wonderful location, super close to transport and in a wonderful neighbourhood but the minute you step inside you forget you’re in a big, bustling city. It’s so lovely and quiet and has everything you could possibly need. We loved our stay and could not recommend highly enough!

This was our first experience of airbnb, so we were naturally apprehensive. We needn't have been. Staying at Sheila's place was an absolute delight. Although the East Village area is bustling and lively, inside all is calm and serene. It was difficult to believe that we were staying in the middle of the city. The facilities inside were great, and there's a warm, homely atmosphere. More than that, our hosts were just fantastic; down to earth, helpful and friendly. We couldn't have been more warmly greeted. They were always on hand if we needed any advice or help, and were able to offer practical tips and advice to help our travel and eating plans. They turned a really good trip into an exceptional one.
Incredible host & location. Highly recommended.

Le logement de Sheila et Manny est bien situé (quartier agréable et vivant, proximité des commerces et des transports). Bon rapport qualité-prix.
Accueil chaleureux de Sheila et Manny; ils sont réactifs et disponibles.
Nous avons passé un excellent séjour. Nous reviendrions sans hésiter.
Merci Sheila et Manny!
Was there anything extra special about this place?  Yes! Everything!!!!

Sheila and Manny were so wonderful. The studio was a great location, only a 5 minute walk to the subway and close to many shops, parks and amazing food! It was very quiet and had everything you needed including a washer/dryer. Sheila and Manny went out of their way to make sure our stay was the best. We would highly recommend staying here, and we plan on coming back to visit again some day!

Ausserordentlich gastfreundlich und an einer sehr, sehr guten Lage!
kann man nur weiterempfehlen. waren zu zweit dort und es gab wirklich nichts zu bemängeln!

This is THE best place in NYC. We felt like we were at home. Sheila and Manny always make us feel so welcome. They also are extremely helpful about nearby places and events. Can’t wait until our next visit!!
great neighborhood, great find!
Sheila and Manny are great hosts.

The apt is really comfortable, cozy and silent. The location is great, close from many restaurants, food markets and metro/bus stations. We were received by Sheila and husband who were very kind with us and our children and were always willing to help.The apt was very clean and all the appliances working well. I would go back without hesitation.
Christian

I absolutely love this cozy place in East Village. The location is amazing and the studio makes you feel at home. Sheila and Manny were really thoughtful and they were able to accommodate us very well. I really recommend this place when you visit NYC.

Sheila and Manny's place is a dream. Centrally located yet quiet, an oasis in the East Village. Sheila and Manny couldn't have been kinder or more helpful. Great local recommendations and a Chinaski shirt for our teenage son. We'll definitely stay here again next time we visit NYC.

This is The place to be when you want to discover New York for the first time. It is perfectly well located, next to a lot of restaurants and drugstores, next to subway. The flat was big enough for my husband, my two children and I. Everything is proposed to spend a very very good and confortable stay. We were like at home. It is sure : we will come here next time !
Located in the middle of historic St. Marks Place, this is a gem that requires your stay!

Highly recommend for families! Sheila and Manny were great. Very hospitable. Many small touches helped make the unit feel very welcoming. The location is excellent. The studio apartment was clean and spacious. We felt very safe. This was particularly important to me, as I needed to work from DC during the week. While I was away, my family was commuting every day to my daughter’s summer ballet workshop. Having Sheila and Manny onsite helped me feel like my wife and kids were being looked out for, which helped keep my mind at ease.

Appartement conforme a la description, ok pour 1 famille de 3 ou 4 (les lit / canape-lit confortable sont dans la meme piece), proprete, tres bien equipe, literie confortable, emplacement central (commerces, cafe, restaurants, ...), quartier sur, logement tres calme (mais peu lumineux), climatisation tres appreciee en ete !

This basement suite is perfect for visiting NYV!  Easy to get around and so many places within walking distance! I highly recommend the Tenement Museum which is within walking distance, we loved it. Loved the beautiful flowers on the table when we arrived along with snacks and a bottle of wine! Stay here, you won't be disappointed!!

Everything about this place is fabulous! Such a cozy, perfect apartment in a great area close to absolutely everything. Sheila was great at responding to all questions etc right away and was super accommodating. Lots of thoughtful touches in the apartment like fresh flowers, snacks. So clean and comfy. Highly recommend this gem of a spot to anyone visiting NYC!

Wer Sheila's Airbnb mietet, kann sich auf eine super freundliche, aufgeschlossene und hilfsbereite Vermieterin, sowie ein schönes, sauberes Appartment freuen!
Die Kommunikation zwischen uns und Sheila verlief immer schnell und reibungslos. 
Falls es Probleme gab oder wir Hilfe brauchten, konnten wir uns jederzeit bei Sheila und ihrem Mann melden und uns wurde sofort geholfen. 
Auch mit Tipps und Ratschlägen stand uns Sheila jederzeit zur Seite, egal ob sie mir und meinen Freundinnen ein gutes Restaurant oder ein schönes Stadtviertel empfahl, mit ihren Tipps lag sie immer goldrichtig!
Das Appartment liegt in einer ruhigen, aber dennoch interessanten Gegend, von welcher man, zum Beispiel mit der nahegelegenen U-Bahn, jeden Winkel der Stadt erreichen kann.
Wir sagen noch einmal Danke an Sheila und ihre Familie für unseren unvergesslichen Aufenthalt in New York! :)

Everything was wonderful I highly recommend Sheila place.
Great location, warm and clean and very comfortable place.
Super host !!!!!
El barrio es muy lindo cerca de la casa hay lineas de metro. Muchos lugares para comer muy bien y hay supermercado abierto toda la noche. Esta cerca de todo!!!

Hervorragende Lage in Manhattan, sehr lebendiges Viertel, in dem man trotzdem ruhig schlafen kann. Unzählige Bars und Restaurants in unmittelbarer Nähe, und wer gern läuft, erreicht alle Klassiker zu Fuß. Wer nicht, findet die nächste Subway Station zwei Straßen weiter.
Buena ubicación, hermoso barrio, cómodo y sobretodo una muy buena atención de parte de Sheila y Manny. Muy recomendable!

Sheila’s apartment is a real gem in the east village - great welcome, hospitality, and the place looks exactly like the photos, if not better ! I would definitely recommend staying here and I would stay here again...
Sheila was very responsive and her listing is in a fantastic location. The pictures don’t do it justice.
We loved our stay here - great location, and lovely to have our own space. We'd definitely stay here again!
Really great apartment with everything you could wish for on a lively vibrant street,all cuisines available within walking distance..we had a great stay & would definitely return
Manny and Sheila are attentive,accommodating,generous hosts. We felt like we were visiting a family member. Location is great and you will have everything you need.
The best host ever plus the most fantastic apartment with all the amenities on your wish list.

Wonderful location with short walk to subway. Close to restaurants and bars. Sheila was a perfect host - checking on us without being bothersome.  We were even invited to her and Manny’s Holiday party. We had  a great time! Would definitely stay here again.

Abbiamo soggiornato nell'appartamento di Sheila e Manny dal 19 al 27 dicembre 2018. L'appartamento è esattamente come si vede dalle foto, la sua localizzazione ottima, nel cuore dell'Est Village, ma in una zona comunque residenziale e tranquilla. C'è tutto e, per chi come noi viaggiava con una bimba piccola, assolutamente un valore aggiunto si è rivelata la disponibilità della lavatrice e dell'asciugatrice. I proprietari sono davvero disponibilissimi: rapidi nelle risposte, pronti a soddisfare le richieste, attenti ai bisogni degli ospiti!
What can I say? Sheila is really a great host. They greet us once we arrived and once we left. Thank you for your warmest greetings and hospitality. Sheila’s place is located at a great locations.

The place is just as nice and clean as it looks in the pictures.  The area is great for walking around and exploring.  Sheila was a gracious host who thinks of all the little things to make your stay enjoyable.  I would gladly stay here again.

Expect a warm welcome, generous hospitality and a lovely apartment in a great location. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, which was made all the more memorable by Sheila and Manny's approach to their guests. They typify what's good about Airbnb.
We had a great holiday in Sheila’s place. Sheila and Manny are very friendly people and we really recommend to stay in their apartment.

Sheila's place in the East Village is absolutely fabulous. She is very responsive and super accommodating to the needs of her guests. The studio is spacious and clean and has everything you need to have a great stay. There is so much to do in the area within walking distance and other means of transportation are available close by, like the subway. I felt like I was at a close relative's home during my 4-day stay here and will surely try to book again if I should be so lucky as to have the opportunity!

name: Hawaii Tiny House (Red)
summary: Mauna Lea Manor is a private 5 acre estate tucked away on the slopes of Hualalai volcano, above Coastal Kona Town.  On the property are 4 cottages.  There is a yoga/dance studio also on site with classes.
space: This is a 400sqft studio cottage with an enclosed bathroom and small kitchenette in the country.  This cottage has 4 beds and if you need another, we can set up a twin size futon in your loft for +$50/night extra.
description: Mauna Lea Manor is a private 5 acre estate tucked away on the slopes of Hualalai volcano, above Coastal Kona Town.  On the property are 4 cottages.  There is a yoga/dance studio also on site with classes. This is a 400sqft studio cottage with an enclosed bathroom and small kitchenette in the country.  This cottage has 4 beds and if you need another, we can set up a twin size futon in your loft for +$50/night extra. There is a yoga/dance studio on site with classes available and mermaid lagoon: hot tub. We are happy to help you find what you need (our home is also on the property)… or we can stay out of your way and give you plenty privacy (it is really up to you- we are easy to find if you need us). Most of the homes in our neighborhood are farms and so they are very spread out.  This is the Kona coffee country. you will want to rent a car-There is a bus that goes around the island but the public transportation is not frequent enough to depend on.  I highly recommend having your own ve
neighborhood_overview: Most of the homes in our neighborhood are farms and so they are very spread out.  This is the Kona coffee country.
transit: you will want to rent a car-There is a bus that goes around the island but the public transportation is not frequent enough to depend on.  I highly recommend having your own vehicle.
access: There is a yoga/dance studio on site with classes available and mermaid lagoon: hot tub.
interaction: We are happy to help you find what you need (our home is also on the property)… or we can stay out of your way and give you plenty privacy (it is really up to you- we are easy to find if you need us).

host.host_about: Aloha!  I’m a dancer, writer, and artist by trade, as well as the mistress of Mauna Lea Manor.  I have grown up on the Big Island of Hawaii (the Orchid Isle) but studied Fine Art in California & Italy receiving my BA in 2002.  I’ve studied dance in Turkey & Egypt and also became certified to teach yoga in Morocco.   I also really enjoy Latin Dance & archery.  If you would like to learn more about me or my artwork, feel welcome to visit stephanie bolton dawt com.

reviews.comments:
This is the best rental place we have ever stayed in.  The owners, Stephanie and Matt became great friends. We all had a lot in common and they both made our stay as perfect as possible.  Their location was peaceful, in private location yet so close to town. It was wonderful waking up to birds, turkeys, donkeys, goats, pigs and anything else that came our way.  Matt and Stephanie showed us great locations and fishing was phenomenal.  Our son, Timothy caught a shark and a 175 pound Marlin. a few 50 lb Maui Maui. Matthew and Timothy got a few boar's.  Our fabulous trip pictures are displayed on Coffee Country Cottage photo displays.  I would recommend them to anyone and have already.  If we get a chance to go to Hawaii again this is definitely where we will stay.  The rental was in great location and very comfortable and convenient.  I hope Matt, Stephanie and their 3 fabulous boys can soon come to Alaska to experience our side of the country.  We miss you lots and speak of you often ;)  We loved that the weather stays the same year around. ;) Not to hot and not to cold.


John, Kim, Matthew and Timothy Rodriguea

I was thrilled to find Coffee Country Cottage and was hoping to get more involved with my Yoga and artwork while on vacation in Hawaii. I knew that there were cats on the property and asked if cats were allowed in the rental where I was staying. I was told that they were not. Unfortunately in the morning the cat was at the door waiting to be allowed inside, and upon further inspection, there was cat hair in various areas (i.e. under the bed and in the corners) which was not picked up. This left me with an allergy attack which took away from two days of my vacation, in addition to the extra expense of having to find another place to stay under short notice. Stephanie was very helpful in trying to locate another place to stay in addition to refunding my money. She has excellent customer service skills and her place is very cute in a great location to visit the various coffee plantations in Kona. The situation itself was just an unfortunate one.

Staying at Stephanie and Matt's property felt like a genuine local experience.  We have been living on Oahu for over a year and this was the first time we felt the true and comfortable seclusion of island living.  Stephanie and Matt were very gracious hosts offering their time for a meal and inviting us to their on property dance studio for lessons!  The cottage slept our whole family comfortably and we felt safe.  We loved the animals all around the property...having a very cute goat for an alarm clock was awesome!  The drive into town for meals and sightseeing was easy and leaving town to enjoy some quiet and a comfortable cottage was lovely.

If you are looking for the true magical Kona experience, this is a good place. The space was very romantic and well decorated. Stephanie was really easy to get in touch with and very helpful. One night we had dinner together and I really enjoyed meeting her family. Her kids are delightful and her husband is a really nice guy. 

The property itself is at the perfect elevation when visiting Kona. Being right on the water can be hot and muggy, being up the hill a ways is a real godsend at night. Driving up the driveway to the house one sees all kinds of flowers - wild orchids and others growing on the side of the road.

The place was really clean and I felt very comfortable in her space.

One thing I really appreciated is that even though it had all the comforts of home, it didn't feel like I was living in someone else's home.

My wife and 2y-o daughter and me spent holidays here more than a week having peacefully beautiful experiences. Impressive and confortable interior, encountering friendly cats and goats and even a wild horse, having BBQ party at the garden also made us happy. Stephanie and Matt had been kindly taking care of us with keeping privacy. One thing we didn’t expected was the whether. Coffee Country Cottage is located at altitude of several handred meters upland so almost every day gets few shower like tropical rainforest. If you prefer to sleep in nice and cool night, the climate makes you happy.

It was a pleasure to have been guests of Stephanie. The cottage is immersed into the nature and at the same time you can reach in 15 minutes the downtown and the seaside. Plus you can enjoy a cool temperature that will help you to sleep very well!! the furnishings are very nice and Stephanie is very helpful for any questions!

Thanks Stephanie!!!

The coffee cottage was a jewel in the Kona jungle. We loved all the details and color in the space. Everything was nicely decorated and accommodating. We stay a week and it was not long enough. Stephanie and Mathew and their beautiful boys were all so nice sharing information about the land and the surrounding area, they even took us out for a delightful sunset cruise on their boat.
Such a peaceful space with the jungle serenade of frogs and insects birds and cows! Would love to swing back by and share more time! Thanks so much!

Aloha! I stayed in this cottage with my husband and two children (ages 6 and 8) for almost 3 months. We loved it there and were sorry to leave. Initially it took a little bit of getting used to a few things like the relatively small space and eating and doing most cooking outside but we soon got used to it! It was great for the kids to be able to play outside and they loved the kittens and baby cows and horse. Big Island is beautiful and so easy going. Try to spend as much time there as you can:-) Stephanie and Matt and their 3 boys are wonderful hosts. They were more than friendly and helpful and we did a lot of things together.
My daughter and I joined Stephanie's Belly Dance classes which we truly enjoyed. You should try it too!
My husband and kids went fishing with Matt and that was a great experience.
We would all recommend renting this cottage if you are looking for a quiet, relaxing getaway and if you want to get to know this awesome family:-)
Stephanie, Matt, Christian, Makaio and Journey: We miss you!

Unfortunately i cannot recommend this spot to anyone. If you do come her, be sure to do so in the daylight, because GPS doesn't work up there, and without very precise directions you will not find it! 9 homes on this rough road all have the same addresses and none of the owners has a clue who this host is. She promised to meet us in the evening, but not only failed to give us directions or tell us how hard it is to find, but wasn't even there at all, didn't asnswer Her phones or texts while we searched over an hour in the dark knocking on neighbors doors.  During our entire stay she never came once to say hello, or give us input, or even check if we alive or gone.  Terribly hosting, apparently couldn't care less.  The quarters are very small and cramped and certainly could not fit more than 2 persons, even though it's advertised as sleeping 6! Where they would all sit at once is beyond me. There is also no kitchen to cook in, and the grounds are unkempt and unattractive, tho we did enjoy the cows and cats.  We won't come here again. I never even saw the host except once when she gave us a lame excuse of having been at the movies when she was supposed to meet us.
Very, very nice place. Extremely quiet and off the beaten path. This is a great place for a serious getaway. We would stay here again. Laundry in town at Tyke's.

We enjoyed our stay in the cottage very much.  It was charming and fun, and so quiet.  The bed was extremely comfortable and the shower was pleasant and roomy.  

We were visiting to attend a friend's busy three-day wedding, and had a fairly tight schedule (so sad!).  It all worked out perfectly, but it would have been nice to have more time.  Next visit.

This is a lovely place... peaceful, comfortable, and well removed from the blandness of Condo Country. Communication was great, the place surpassed expectations, we would definitely come back. Thanks Stephanie.

The cottage was amazing!  Great relaxing energy and comfort.  The space provided a serene environment to wind down after working during the day.  Stephanie was equally great!  She answered all questions in a timely manner and invited us to dance, which I will do next time I visit!  Tianna was also extremely helpful.   I look forward to my next stay here.

Das Cottage entsprach den Bildern mit schöner Lage im Grünen, netter Terrasse und sehr bequemen Betten. Die Kinder liebten die Katzen, der Spielplatz mit Schaukel war leider während unseres Aufenthaltes nicht zugänglich. Der Bootsausflug mit Mathew und seinem Sohn Journey war einmalig schön mit gutem Fischfang (Mahimahi, Ono) und sogar Beobachtung von Walen und Delfinen. Gerne hätten wir noch mehr Fisch gegessen...

The Red Coffee Cottage was really a beautiful place to stay! 
We enjoyed our time and travelling on the Big Island was amazing!
Stepahnie and her family were very supportive all the time and the only thing we regret is that we werent able to stay longer and to visit a dance night or one of the options they offered! :)
Thanks for our wonderful time & best regards

We loved our short and sweet time here! The cool nights, the peaceful setting, and the attention to details. 
Stephanie has made a lovely place to visit that feels far from the Disneyland-vibe of Kona. 
Mahalo, Gretchen
The cottage was lovely, a perfect spot a bit away from town!

The cottage was just as described. It was elegantly rustic - it felt like glamping to us! Lovely comfy beds, well stocked kitchenette,luxurious deep tub - and cows that came ad visited us over the fence each morning and wild pigs that trundled through merrily. We loved it.

As an added and unexpected pleasure we were graced with a home made coffee cake upon our arrival and then freshly caught fish that we grilled and enjoyed thoroughly. 

A delightful stay! Thank you!
Great vacation spot! Quiet and well appointed cottage. It had basically everything we needed.

Wonderful cottage up in the mountain side. The place looks just as amazing as the pictures. You can tell that Stephanie is an artist. This place provided us with a totally relaxing environment for winding down our 2-week trip to Hawaii. My wife and I took the bottom bed, while my youngest slept on the top bunk and my oldest in the loft. Another nice aspect is that you are at 1500+ feet of elevation, which means that the cottage is nice and cool at night, even when Kona itself is hot and humid. On top of it all, my wife had Hula lessons on her bucket list. Stephanie graciously invited her to come along to a special lesson which was happening in town.
The house is tucked in at the end of the road, offered a quiet atmosphere during the stay. The decoration inside the house is pretty.
Woo wee the villa was amazing so cool and perfect for our trip. Great little place and we loved the bunk beds.

We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Red Coffee Country Cottage. If you are looking for a quiet, private accommodation this is the place. Stephanie has the place well stocked and it is very artfully decorated. The large tub is a definite plus. The cottage is located at approximately 2,000 foot elevation, so nights and mornings are cooler and more comfortable than at sea level. This is one of the quietest places we have ever stayed and even though there were other guests at the property(adjacent cottages), we had sufficient privacy. Special bonus: neighborhood cows, feral chickens and a very friendly cat passed through occasionally. Kailua-Kona waterfront and the airport are a 15-20 minute drive, and the location on Hwy 180 makes reaching destinations north and south very easy. One very minor disappointment - there is wifi available, but signal was unreliable within the cottage. We had best connectivity from the lanai. Cell signal was sufficiently strong to keep us connected to friends and family. 
We would definitely return!

Our cottage was very artistically laid out, with most attractive paintings by a very talented host, decorating the walls and a very elegant and comfortable bed. Information about area places of interest was in the room, parking was most convenient. Although there was no breakfast in the room, ample eating utensils and bottled drinking water were available.
nice cottage... Very nice hide out place. Recommend for a small family.
We loved the peace and tranquility, the guayabas, and the little town down the road. It was a perfect place to land on the big island!
The tiny house was beautiful and the yard was quiet and very nice. Stephanie was flexible and friendly and we really enjoyed our stay over New Years.
Excellent host, location and vibe.

I wasn't able to meet Stephanie because we arrived late and left early, but she helped us greatly by offering to pick up a few thing for breakfast and leave them in the fridge.  So great! She just left the receipt and I reimbursed her.  Much appreciated after a long night of travel.  Place was clean, as described, and we even were able to stretch in the dance studio when we woke up.  I would highly recommend the Tiny House!

We had a lovely time, the cottage was so beautiful and creative! Highlights were drinking wine on the side patio in the evening with the string lights and passionflower arbor overhead, and the awesome king bunk bed with comfy blankets and pillows. Be prepared for the drive up the last road, our little car struggled a bit with the hill. It felt a bit like climbing up a mountain to a castle, though, so worth it in the end! Between the nice over head fan and screens and the lovely electric fireplace, we were comfortable whether we wanted to cool off or warm up.

We really enjoyed our stay at the Red Cottage! Stephanie and Matt are fantastic hosts. They provided great advice on what to see and do in the area. We really enjoyed the fishing trip with Matt and the Zouk class we attended. The property is beautiful, and The cottage is roomy enough for a family to stay comfortably. Being at 2000' above sea level means temperatures drop to the 60s at night, which is perfect after a hot day on the coast.

Unique and fun place to explore! Very friendly and detail oriented host. This is one of a kind place you must try out if you like the tribe like style. The room setup matches exactly in the pictures. Everything is clean, well organized. They provide beach towel, surfing board and chairs! They even have a dance studio nearby if you'd like to see and try some Hawaiian moves. Highly recommend!

What a great place! From the beginning, Stephanie was super helpful and the cottage was perfect for our family vacation. Our goal for our trip was to cover as much of the island as possible in 7 days, so we needed a place that was centrally located to the activities that Kona had to offer, but we also needed to be able to hit the road without having to wind through town to get to points beyond.  We also wanted to be far from the noise of Kona....We like to visit town, not stay there.  
Before our arrival, Stephanie sent us a questionnaire so that she'd know our basic needs prior to arrival and then shortly before our departure for the Big Island, she made sure we had detailed directions on how to reach their property(You have to have a car to get there.). We followed the directions and made it there with no problem, even in the dark.  Parking was easy and there was plenty of it. She lit the string lights for us on our lanai to make finding the correct cottage easy. Raj, the cat greeted us warmly, but then made himself scarce the rest of our stay. Don't let him in by the way. Stephanie is trying to keep the places allergen free for her guests. It was easy to make ourselves at home. Our 12 year old loved the loft and our 5 year old went up and down the loft ladder a lot, but we didn't allow her to sleep up there. The nights are cooler up in Holualoa, so our cottage was equipped with a little electric fireplace that worked like a charm. We miss having breakfast on the lanai every (Website hidden by Airbnb) peaceful. 
Communicating with Stephanie was easy. She replaced our hot plate as soon as we told her the one we had was having a problem. We had a water issue one day and she had that taken care of by the time we got home from our next adventure. We couldn't figure out how to open our green coconut and the next thing we knew, the troops arrived to cut it open for us! 
We enjoyed our stay to pieces and we had the most amazing time! What a great place! The only complaint we had was that we had no time or energy left in our days to enjoy any dance classes with Stephanie. Our kids were begging to go to bed by dark every day! Ha! 
We suggested outdoor wall hooks to Stephanie and Matt before we left because of all our drippy snorkel gear and soggy towels. We hope we didn't damage their patio furniture with our wet gear..... 2 days or weeks, the Tiny Red House is the perfect home away from home!
She was really friendly, easy to talk to

Well equipped and comfortable airbnb - quite beautiful and very unique.  Communication with was great and Stephanie was very helpful and attentive.  Thank you for a memorable and inspiring week on Big Island!

1.Aribnb로 6박을 잤어요..
외국인 리뷰보고 예약했는데..
OMG!!! 
2.시내랑 거리가 14분인데 엄청 구불구불한 길에 입구도 한번에 찾기 어렵다, 
3.하와이 시골.. 집은 늘 어둡고 습하며 개미가 많다
4.깔끔한 곳을 찾는다면 여긴 비추
5.6일동안 12시간 숙면을 했다..
   분위기가 반지하수준...
6. 완벽한 주방, 해변에서 쓸수 있는 의자,보드 있음
7. 야외 바베큐 더러움 
8. 침구.. 냄새난다 언제 교체했는지 알수없다 청소비가 아깝다


I stayed for 7 days in this house.
Before reservation,
I read user's review and comment
Lovely, Fantastic, Awesome

After staying,
I wrote real review

1.location
Location is good to go anywhere you want. 
It's takes 14 min from house to kona town.

Problems is that
it was difficult to find the house.
You should find tiny house symbol
And then turn left at the corner (if you come from kona town or airport) and go up 0.5 mile more.

I felt a little bit scared at night.


2.room condition

@Room is clean But Is's not a hotel
Bed cover is fabric so a little bit wet 

@Kitchen is clean But there are lots ants.

@The more time past, the more ants appeared from kitchen to living room, also restroom too
Although  I didn't have any food.

The hell of ants
I don't know it's nothing special in hawaii. 

But My family are really hate ants.  I worried about my beds everyday 
Especially My daughter is 3 years old. She sit down everywhere. When she sit down living room during watching ipad, she said to me "dad! Look at ant! get rid of it please"

@bbq implements at the outside was dirty. I don't want to use it


3.weather
It was rainny for six days except 1 day. Surprisingly, kona town was rainny just 2 days. 

Weather is relative to location.
The house is located at top of holualua town so always cloudy and rainny.

It's difficult to dry laundry and towers from sun shines. 
No electronic washing mashine.


4.Convient
@In the evening, No way. Nothing to do. No one, no body near house.

@dark light in room
Main light wasn't turn on so room looks like deary. 

@No shampoo, lack of towels, no hair dryer
There was no shampoo and I can find only 2 towels for 7 days, three persons. No hair dryer (I checked hair dryer prepared item at the air b&b before booking)

I called house owner and request for that. Opportunitly owner gave us shampoo, more towels, hair dryer. Thanks.

@prepared swimming stub
You can find a Suffering board, beach chairs, beach towels.
It's good thing


<< summary >>
If only one night or two nights is ok!
But three or more is not ok!

go back to past, I shoud choice a hotel near the kona town. Because you can enjoy your evening time well.

I couldn't see her because she is in California. Everything was setting up perfectly. Before you go to her house, you need to remember what she explain about her house direction. 
It looks sweet and clean, but some dust I can feel... (old house)
There are no air conditioner but it is cool. :-) 
This house is very helpful for your vacation. there are several stuff you can use.

I rented the Green, Red and Yellow cottages with a group of 9 people for 4 nights.  The location is unique and the cottages are nicely decorated and welcoming.  We all enjoyed staying here, and it was very conveniently located to Kona Town.  The location made it easy to have a home base to drive to different locations on the Big Island.  Stephanie was very helpful regarding the details of the trip.
That said, the previous reviewers were right about the ant issue- we found ants in each cottage, and they were not just limited to the kitchen area.  They were in the bathroom and living areas too, and they were there when we got there.  In addition, the shower curtains in all three cottages were very moldy.

Eine sehr freundliche und hilfsbereite Gastgeberin. Guter, entspannter Kontakt. Das Haus wie beschrieben, ein besonderes Ambiente mit dem Etagenbett (wie auf den Fotos). Zwei zusätzliche Schlafplätze auf der Galerie. Sitzplatz aussen beim Red Tiny House mit freiem Blick.
My husband and I enjoyed our stay with Stephanie! Her cottage was very comfortable and beautiful. It was a great place to relax after a day of exploring!

Walls full of art and inspiration in each private cottage (we had the chance to stay in red and blue); Well situated between the airport and city centre. Looking forward to staying here again on our next visit!

The Tiny Red House was a great base for our trip to Kona for the Ironman World Championship. 

Although it has 6 comfortable beds, do be aware that it is a very compact set up. The hosts are entirely upfront about this. If you are planning on visiting as a group, would that group be happy to share a tent, or a caravan, or a small sailing boat? The accommodation is similarly compact and intimate. But for 2-3 adult close friends, or a family of 3-6, it's great! The location has really comfortable night time temperatures, and is just far away enough to escape the hurly burly of Kona (15mins by car).

We had a fantastic stay. 
The overall atmosphere of the Red Tiny House was perfect, it was so peaceful. 
Stephanie was lovely and welcoming. We went fishing with Mat and had a great experience. Would go back in an instant.
Nice place. And so quite^^ and clean ^^
The Red Cottage is a marvelous place to relax and unwind, our family enjoyed our time here, recommend to all

My family and I (6 people) stayed for 2 nights in the Red Tiny House and really enjoyed our experience. The interior design is stunning, you have everything you need, plus it's only a 15-min drive to Kailua downtown. Stephanie was nice enough to share eggs with us and give us some tips on what to visit on the Island.

Stephanie's estate was beautiful! The red room where we stayed for 4 nights was perfect for our visit to the Big Island. 

The room was spacious, comfortably sleeping four people, a lovely bathroom and very usable kitchen the house made our stay a dream. 

Stephanie and her family were extremely welcoming, and friendly. Giving us advice on the best places to go, and also inviting us to join them on several occasions. Additionally, Stephanie allowed us to use their Lagoon hot tub which was spectacular in the night time! 

We wouldn't hesitate to go back, there's so much property to explore and you just want to spend forever there. 

You will however need a car, as it's about 10 minutes from shops and food.

Stephanie's tiny house was incredible to stay in. Clean, beautiful and plenty of bed space. Great kitchenette and amazing bathroom. The property is gorgeous. We loved looking for eggs. The hot tub is incredible! Stephanie was polite and showed us around when we got there. Only wish we could have stayed longer!
Great spot close to town. Very quiet. Appreciated the eggs and coffee.
Lovely. Fascinating. Artistic. Quiet.
Very nice place!

Stephanie's place was unique and comfortable. We had a group of eight so we stayed in the red and blue houses. The blue house was more spacious than the red, but both would comfortably fit 5 people. The houses were a little hard to locate at first, but Stephanie was helpful with providing directions. It gets really cold in the houses at night/early morning, and the roosters/chickens will definitely wake you up in the morning. Overall, it was a good experience.
This place was a great place to stay! We liked the decor, the interior design, and the lovely eggs from your chickens!

Stephanie's place is awesome! We stayed in the red cottage. It was very cozy, but more than enough space for the 2 of us. Stephanie shared some fresh eggs from their chickens with us, which were delicious. We also had a fun morning doing some archery on their archery adventure.

The location is about a 15-20 minute drive from town, so don't expect to be able to walk to any restaurants. It wasn't a big deal for us though.

We had a great time staying at the Red House. We enjoyed the sounds of the frogs at night and waking up to wild turkeys/chickens. Also saw a wild boar! There were problems with an ant infestation as well as a couple cockroaches though, so make sure to not leave food lying around. The shower curtains also had some mildew but overall our stay was enjoyable. Please also be careful of the giant speed bumps leading to the houses. Needed to drive extremely slowly to avoid scraping our rental vehicle. Overall, we would recommend this Airbnb if you would like to stay off the beaten track in a unique location close to nature.

The location is in a secluded area about 20 min from tourist area where is location of main grocery stores, restaurants and shopping. The Little Red Cottage was comfortable downstairs but upstairs loft bedroom area difficult for two adults to climb and cramped. Bathroom nice with plenty of towels. Outside cabana is in poor condition and being taken over by hanging vines making it unusable. Host was not there at check-in and never acknowledged us during our 2 night stay.  Advised her of ant problem in kitchen upon our checkout.

We strongly recommend this place! 
The cottage is clean, spacious, can comfortably accommodate 6 people. There was enough bath towels, beach towels, kitchen utensils... The cottage has everything you may need and even more (even blender and outside grill!) The sitting area outside is perfect for enjoying afternoons. You can see the ocean from the cottage and the sitting area! The location of the cottage is perfect! The cottage is on the hill slope, surrounded by the tropical garden - perfect to escape the heat!
Stephanie is a great host! It was very easy to communicate with her. She replied to our questions in no time! I love that she prepared a folder with  all useful information about the cottage and big island (beaches, cities, attractions...). She has a unique taste and I like how she decorated the cottage. 
We really enjoyed staying at the red cottage! We plan to come back! 
Mahalo, Stephanie!!!
If you really love the nature and bugs, you may like this place. It is far from everything. We booked for 5nights, but we moved to another hotel after 2days due to ants.
So eine schöne Unterkunft und zentral zu Kona gelegen. Mit der Natur verbunden. Sehr zu empfehlen
Great stay! We highly recommend this tiny home. Stephanie is super friendly and helpful. The location is peaceful and serene. Easy access to anything in Kona with car rental. Spacious and comfy.

All we really wanted was a quiet, solitary place that my friends and I could spend some time.  We loved sitting on the patio, watching the rain.  The grounds were very peaceful and we liked to watch the wildlife.

Stephanie was able to accommodate my little family on almost no notice. The red cottage is exactly as pictured and was super comfortable but still had the island feel. We truly appreciated her hospitality and especially loved the farm fresh eggs for breakfast! Thank you, Stephanie!
Loved it! Such an amazing place for a girls’ trip. Stephanie was amazing and the yoga class was a hit! Would definitely stay again. :)
Perfect get away from our busy lives on Oahu!! So peaceful and beautiful place to stay!! We Loved every moment!!
Nice house! Everything you need for a nice stay close to Kona. Beautiful furniture and details. Would stay here again!
We enjoyed our stay in kailua kona. It was lovely to stay in the coffee region. The house was lovely and very comfortable. We found it to be a great base for exploring the island.

The Tiny Red House is exactly as pictured!  I LOVED the faux fireplace for ambiance and a tiny bit of warmth in the evenings!  The lanai or patio with the lovely outdoor lights was lovely.  The location was perfect for my vacation - a serene and beautiful mountain hide-away that was conveniently close enough to everything Kona has to offer!  Stephanie was a thoughtful hostess, the mermaid lagoon was fabulous and the Mauna Lea Manor property is lush and beautiful!  Mahalo!

This place is so great for experiencing Hawaii. The location, up on the mountain, provides great views as well as a fun soundtrack at night. Stephanie is a great, accommodating host. The space was so convenient for 4 of us AND the location was only 15 minutes from majority of the places we visited. Definitely would stay here again.

It is a nice property but could use some updating the wildlife around the units are nice but barking dogs are somewhat disappointing on occasion. The temperature is around 10 degrees cooler than downtown Kona which is nice the until do not have air conditioning but we only had three days of hot temperatures, all in all It is a good value
Super, super cute place. Thanks!

Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here.  It was small but cozy and having cooler evenings and mornings was nice for packing up in the mornings and cooling off each evening.  This place was centrally located to the beaches and things we enjoy doing and was quicker access in traffic than staying in town.  It was quiet, clean and kid friendly and safe.  Thanks again!
Quiet and peaceful place, great location for Kailua.

name: Bondi beach at your doorstep.
summary: Beautiful Bondi beach pad with view to the beach.  This bright and sunny top floor studio is located right at the beach. Coffee shops, restaurants and a surf school are at the doorstep. Bus stop is at 150m. This place is perfect for summer holidays. Come and try the lively Bondi lifestyle.
description: Beautiful Bondi beach pad with view to the beach.  This bright and sunny top floor studio is located right at the beach. Coffee shops, restaurants and a surf school are at the doorstep. Bus stop is at 150m. This place is perfect for summer holidays. Come and try the lively Bondi lifestyle.

host.host_about: I'm Hungarian, very friendly and peaceful.

reviews.comments: Tout était parfait, la localisation, la vue, l’appartement décoré avec goût, la ville etc... je recommande sans aucune hésitation cet appartement. De plus Kinga est une hôte très sympathique et arrangeante. J’espère pouvoir y revenir un jour !

name: Double Room In Shared Designer Apartment
summary: You will love your beach side stay with us in our little Manly gem, which is on the top floor of a boutique 1950s art deco block. Our light filled apartment is decked out with designer furnishings and everything you might need for a stay filled with luxury and comfort. We are a 5 minute walk to shops, cafes, restaurants, harbour beaches and the Manly ferry (you can watch it come and go through your bedroom window!) and beach. We are Manly locals, so anything you need to know feel free to ask!
description: You will love your beach side stay with us in our little Manly gem, which is on the top floor of a boutique 1950s art deco block. Our light filled apartment is decked out with designer furnishings and everything you might need for a stay filled with luxury and comfort. We are a 5 minute walk to shops, cafes, restaurants, harbour beaches and the Manly ferry (you can watch it come and go through your bedroom window!) and beach. We are Manly locals, so anything you need to know feel free to ask! Shared Kitchen/dining Shared Living room Your private bedroom Shared Bathroom Laundry We are often working from home, so will be around if you need anything. We are also always contactable via phone or the air bnb platform to answer any questions! We are a five minute walk from Manly village, ferry terminal and harbour. The beach is just a short stroll away and if you feel like checking out Sydney city, you can take the ferry (highly recommend- it’s a beautiful trip!) or bus. We have on street par
neighborhood_overview: We are a five minute walk from Manly village, ferry terminal and harbour. The beach is just a short stroll away and if you feel like checking out Sydney city, you can take the ferry (highly recommend- it’s a beautiful trip!) or bus.
transit: We have on street parking and a permit that you can use whilst you are here. The ferry into the city is just a 5 minute walk away, as is the beach, harbour and Manly village.
access: Shared Kitchen/dining Shared Living room Your private bedroom Shared Bathroom Laundry
interaction: We are often working from home, so will be around if you need anything. We are also always contactable via phone or the air bnb platform to answer any questions!
house_rules: - No shoes in the house and no wine on the rug! ;)

host.host_about: I am very excited to welcome you to beautiful Manly! I have spent many years travelling the world, visiting so many amazing places- but there are none quite like home. I love where I live and can give you tips on all my favourite places in this little neighbourhood.

reviews.comments:
The place is beautiful. The room is big, the bed really comfortable and you even have Manly Harbor views when the weather is nice. 

Jackie and Martin are honestly some of the nicest and friendliest people I've ever met. They were super welcoming and nice and if you want to know any cool places that you can visit don't hesitate to ask, they know a lot about Sydney and Australia in general. I'll definitely be back at their place.
Great hosts, nice place, beautiful location. Recommended!
I loved my second stay at Jackie and Martin's place. They're such kind people and the place is simply amazingly comfortable :)

Many thx for Jackie and her husband for having me as a guest in their super lovely and clean apartment, the place is exactly the same as it shows on profile , plus i can see the ocean from my cosy room with sunshine wake-up call in the morning :) , i will definitely go back to their place for my next visit to manly beach :)

Close to the heart of things in Manly (although a wee bit of a steep walk back up to apartment). Jackie was happy to go above & beyond to ensure a lovely stay - beautiful apartment! Very friendly & welcoming. Comfy & very peaceful with beautiful view!

Jackie + Marty are terrific hosts + their designer apartment in Manly is extremely desirable. The communication was clear, honest + accurate + the apartment exactly what the images show (if not better!) - waking up to the sea breeze + a view to the harbour was so relaxing! A short walk to the harbour this apartment makes for the great overnight or weekend stay! A  Manly must!

Jackie and Martin are amazing. This was my first time using air bnb and I couldn’t have had a better experience. I was only there for 2 nights but Jackie and Martin made me feel very welcome and comfortable. This is a great location, you can walk to the beach in a few minutes and was able to utilise a parking permit which Jackie and Martin provided to park on the street. Beautiful home and a lovely couple, would absolutely stay again.

Jackie and Martin, the hosts were kind, considerate and welcoming.  The flat is beautifully designed and stylishly appointed. The bedroom is compact and absolutely fine for a short stay.  There is a steep hill up to the flat to keep you fit!
Jackie en Martin zijn zeer gastvrij en vriendelijk. Hun huis is een plaatje uit een  woonmagazines. Inrichting en verzorging top geregeld. Een prettige plaats voor een rustig verblijf.
Nice stay, perfect if you want to be close to Manly
Jackie and Martin were amazing and went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and comfortable for the entire trip.  Check in was very easy and there were no issues whatsoever during our stay.
Jackie & Martin were wonderful hosts and we had a great time in their home.
Most amazing room ever! Cosy bed, awesome furniture and lovely host! Highly recommend this place !
Best Aur b n b hosts in a lovely place and location!  So friendly and helpful - delightful people - made us feel right at home! Can’t recommend more highly!!

You will be delighted with your stay with Jackie and Martin. They are very considerate, welcoming and inclusive .
We were most taken by their engagement in conversations about our mutual love of travels and other experiences.
It was such a pleasure to be accomodated in their stylish apartment.
Jackie was such a lovely, creative, and hospitable host. It was my birthday and I receieved a handwritten card. The apartment was clean, peaceful, and highly curated. I would definitely return!

Jackie and Martin were amazing hosts and made us feel at home! The space was styled beautifully and sparkly clean. Was just a short walk to the centre of Manly, the beach and close to great food! The perfect place to stay in Manly! Will definitely be back again :)

A very bright, modern and exceptionally clean home. Fabulous views of Manly and the Heads from your room and the living room.  The walk up from Manly Ferry is scenic but steep. ....great exercise.. the hosts Jackie and Martin are very helpful and considerate.  It is a shared bathroom and all other facilities with the hosts but wasnt a problem for us for the two nights. Would recommend this little Gem of quiet and handy location.

Jackie and Martin are great hosts. The apartment and my room were beautiful, clean and quiet. I had lovely views of the harbour. Martin was there to meet me and offer advice about the best places to swim. Thank you for a relaxing and enjoyable stay!

Jackie has created a beautiful space in this airy and spacious apartment. The room was perfectly clean, with an extremely comfortable bed, and a great view over Manly at sunrise. Jackie is a very accommodating host and I’d recommend this place to anyone travelling to Manly.

Oh my word. This place is so beautiful! Communication with Jackie was exceptional and she left wonderfully clear instructions for finding the apartment. 

Jackie and Martin are delightful and the house is spotless. The walk up the hill to the house after a day in the sun certainly got my heart pumping, but it’s in a really good location. I sure hope you’ll have us again sometime!

Really convenient location for exploring Manly, and a beautiful flat. Design touches are really nice, and the room has a view of the harbour. Everything was perfectly clean, and the bed was very comfortable. Jackie and Martin are very kind hosts, very welcoming and helpful. Would recommend to anyone.
Great stay.=)
The apartment is immaculate, yet homely, and the  facilities exceeded my expectations. The hosts made me feel relaxed and at home. Will definitely stay here again...
This is the perfect place to stay in Manly! Would highly recommend!!

It was such a pleasure to stay at Jackie’s apartment! It’s super beautiful, very clean and full of light ;) It is located in this quiet area of Manly and you have to walk a little bit up the hill , but the bay views from the bedroom are totally worth it ! Jackie and Matt are great hosts, very helpful and responsive. They made this long list with recommended places for coffee, lunch, dinner and things to do, see. I felt very welcome at their place and at the same time I had my own space. All in all, it was a great experience , I would totally recommend Jackie’s place to anyone who wants to explore Manly !

Jackie’s place is gorgeous, a very
welcoming space with lovely hosts to match. Great local tips also. Thanks again!

I really enjoyed staying with Jackie and Martin.
The apartment is as beautiful as it is on the photos with stylish furniture and cute little plants.
The minimalistic style inspired me to live like they do!
Thank you for making me feel at home and being such a great host. Would love to come back!!

We had a wonderful stay at Jackie's place in Manly. Everything was great and we were made to feel so welcome. The location was perfect for us, we were able to leave the car behind and enjoyed the ferry ride over to the city.....we would highly recommend Jackie's place to anyone coming to Sydney.
Rodney and Nokie
Great place for a stopover in Manly! Sunny morning views from the room and Jackie and Martin were very easygoing and friendly, with some good tips for places to go in Manly. Thanks guys!
Can not recommend this airbnb highly enough! The hosts are stellar. The accomodation is great and the location is an easy walk from the ferry and beach. Highly recommend

Jackie was an amazing host! Her apartment is as cute as the pictures. She provided a space heater when it was cold, made me tea, and even gave me her bananas when I came home starving! Staying here was the best, I would recommend it to anyone.
What a wonderful place to stay. Jackie and Martin’s hospitality was definitely a highlight and their cosy fireplace a pure delight. Highly recommended.
Great stay
Jackie is an amazing host! Would definitely stay here again. Beautiful, clean, and walking distance to cafes and shops!
My wife and I stayed with Jackie and Martin for 4 nights, they couldn’t have been more helpful and their flat is the perfect space with great views across Manly Bay - we would definitely stay again!

Lovely clean apartment a few mins walk from beach. However the owners are there all the time, sleeping in room next door. If you want a private getaway, perhaps not the best place as there is no opportunity for privacy at all. Bring your eye mask unless you like waking up with birds as the room is full of light with no curtains.
A conseiller sans problème.
Beautiful space, awesome location very close to everything. Parking was a little hard but where isn’t hard to find a park in Sydney!

Jackie with her husband were very helpful, They gave us the map with the local stuff to do, also They recommend us the local restaurants. We could stay longer in the appartment before our flight. The flat is Beautiful and amazig. We really would like to return one day :)
Nice place, beautifully renovated. Handy to down town Manly and the ferry. My room even had a desk which was perfect for catching up with some work.
Highly recommended! Jackie and Martin are such exceptional hosts. My husband and I had enjoyed staying with them for two nights at their gorgeous apartment. Thank you again, guys!
It's a lovely place in a great location.  The hosts are very friendly and helpful.

That was definitely the best Airbnb we've ever stay at! Lovely hosts always happy to chat with you but without overwhelming, beautiful apartment (if you are worried that photos are photoshoped and better than the reality - you don't have to, the place is amazing ;), great location (yes, even with the ocean view in the distance), local tips what to explore. 10/10!

Stay here when you go to Manly!! Jackie and Martin were the most amazing hosts. The place is very easy to access. Their home is a dream to be in. Would recommend their place to anyone first before staying anywhere.  They’re the best couple. Jackie even made me a tea brew when I wasn’t feeling well. Thanks again for an amazing stay!

We enjoyed our Sydney visit from Manly. Why? Because it was great to drive every morning via ferry into the city and to have the great view on the harbour bridge, the skyline and of course the great opera. In fact that was our initial reason to book our days at Jackies flat. In our eyes the best way to travel smoothly into the city without any stress. Our „home“ was great as well, we enjoyed the beautiful flat from the first second on. Worth to mention: Jackie and her husband are great conversation partners.

Having to be in Manly for work always lends itself to a stay like this one. Jackie and Martin were wonderful hosts, easy to communicate with and really enjoyable to be hosted by.

Manly is a beautiful suburb, the unit is walking distance to everything and like the area has both charm and history. THe really surprise is inside. The renovation is elegant, tasteful and professional. The room itself has water views and is comfortable and functional.

It’s on my list to revisit next time I back bu the sea!

Amazing place and amazing people
Was abit of a last minute thing for us but that was no problem with them
There was great communication on how to find the place
A leaflet of places to eat and things to do ect
And the location was a couple of minutes walk from the ferry terminal
Would recomend
Amazing place, amazing people!
Had great stay. The apartment is clean and stylish and very close to the beach. Would definitely recommend.

What an amazing apartment, in a beautiful part of Sydney & hosted by the most welcoming couple. Jackie & Martin were the perfect hosts & made me feel at home from the very first moment. 

Jackie was always very quick to reply to my messages, and they were very accommodating, even when I checked in 7 hours late due to a cancelled flight.

I will be sure to return next time I’m in the area.

The alpha and omega of m
My Air B&B
You have a nice room, comfortable bed and a great view to the wharf from your room. Jackie and Martin are helpful and very kindly person. We highly recommended this room in Manly.

I loved this place and hated to leave! Martin and Jackie are so kind and were perfect hosts.
